page.title: 12LAW AND ORDER IN WHALTON
page.content: There are no courts in the area and no police office or policeman based in this survey block. The area is served by police from Northumbria Police Authority based in the nearby towns of Morpeth and Ponteland and also a local officer in Belsay. The local Magistrates and County Courts are based in Morpeth and the higher Courts in Newcastle upon Tyne. Crime is a problem as in other country areas. Burglaries are increasingly common because of ease of transport for criminals and the isolation of many dwellings. As well as private houses the church had lead worth Â£1,500 stolen from its roof within 10 days of completion of repairs costing Â£55,000. The school and public house have also been burgled several times. Other forms of crime save for motoring offences occur only rarely.
